description: The largest of the mini-macaws, the Severe is predominantly green with chestnut-colored patches on its forehead and cheeks, and blue on its crown.
temperament: Intelligent, comical, and can be very engaging. They are known for being cranky and nippy if not handled consistently, but can be very affectionate with their chosen people.
loudness: Very Loud for its size. They have a harsh, loud call that they use frequently, especially when excited or demanding attention.
vocalization: Excellent talkers. Many can develop a clear and extensive vocabulary, often rivaling that of larger parrots.
dietaryNeeds: A standard macaw diet of pellets, fresh fruits, vegetables, and a moderate amount of nuts.
healthPointers: A generally hardy bird with a lifespan of 30+ years. They can become obese if their diet is too high in fat and they don't get enough exercise.
housing: Requires a large cage, at least 36"W x 24"D x 48"H. Their significant noise level makes them a poor choice for apartments.
